name: Subsurvival
description:
A wonky physics based submarine survival game.

Worked on by: 
Code -  Dodgy_Merchant
Illustration - Becca
Music - Bryyyan [Twitter]

The current build of the game is VERY work in progress and doesn't do the game idea justice. The picture is a mock-up of the original idea.

The idea was to have a submarine survival game in which the player had to juggle multiple systems at a time while dealing with wonky physics.
F.e. mice would damage machinery wich would be disabled and cause other problems. the captain would cause damage to the ship, flooding it in the process.
Many systems would affect each other and cause an steady increase in difficulty with the goal to survive as long as possible.

But alas the game wasn't finished in time and thus only this "test" version is available.
In its current for the game doesn't offer any of the systems fully and only part of the wonky physics.

No I understand why everybody despises the GM built in physics

Controlls:

WASD - Movement

Teporary Debug Commands:

Y,X - Spin the ship
J - Debug overlay
P - Collision editor (many collision structures wont crash the game but more doesn't always mean better)
